alert.note: Alert for Lyon; Plymouth; Sioux; Woodbury (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued June 17 at 3:29AM CDT until June 20 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 108 possible and nighttime heat index values not falling below 75. * WHERE...Portions of east central, south central and southeast South Dakota, northeast Nebraska and northwest and west central Iowa. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Yankton Sioux Tribal Nation. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. Winds, especially Sunday and Monday, will gust to 30 to 40 mph at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This watch encompasses the area that has the highest chance of heat indices above 100 degrees for 3 days. Areas near and west of the Interstate 29 corridor can expect the hottest heat indices Saturday. Dangerous heat is likely to spread across the region Sunday and is focused further east in southwest Minnesota, northeast Nebraska, and northwest Iowa on Monday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
